inout

Class Model

  • java.lang.Object
    • inout.Model

  • public class Model
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that loads and is referred to for model data including vertex, normal, texture, and others.
    Author:
    Christopher Dombroski

    • Method Detail

      • face

        private int[] face(java.lang.String[] line)
        Because a .obj file has 4 different formats for indices, face must figure out which one it is and parse through it. The face information represents the index of vertices that form a polygon on the model.
        Parameters:
        line - A String[] of integers containing face info
        Returns:
        An int[] of face info

      • fileParser

        private void fileParser(java.lang.String fileText)
        Parse through a .obj file.
        Parameters:
        fileText -

      • floats

        private float[] floats(java.lang.String[] line)
        A worker method to parse a String[] into a float[]
        Parameters:
        line - A String[] containing several numbers
        Returns:
        A float[] from the supplied String[]

      • genNormals

        private java.util.ArrayList<float[]> genNormals()
        For a large number of models there is no normal data so it must be generated. It finds the surface normals and adds them up to find the vertex normal. Normal info is necessary for shading.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the normals

      • initAll

        private void initAll()
        Do any operations needed such as transforming data for triangulating or generating normals.

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String inputFileName)
        Open and read the file with the supplied filename.
        Parameters:
        inputFileName -

      • removeEmpty

        private java.lang.String[] removeEmpty(java.lang.String[] line)
        Remove the empty values for a String[]
        Parameters:
        line - Some random String[]
        Returns:
        A new String[] without empty spaces

      • toArray

        private static float[] toArray(java.util.List<float[]> list,
              int stride)
        Take some random List of float[] and turn it into a float[] containing the data. Useful for when a List is not the proper format.
        Parameters:
        list - The data to be transformed.
        stride - How many places the data is before it goes onto the next List float[]
        Returns:
        A float[]

      • toArrayI

        private static int[] toArrayI(java.util.List<int[]> list,
             int stride)
        Same as toArray but for int[]
        Parameters:
        list - How many places the data is before it goes onto the next List int[]
        stride -
        Returns:
        An int[]

      • triangulate

        private void triangulate(int[] sides)
        Input an n-sided convex polygon and turn it into a bunch of triangles. This is useful for when drawing triangles is the only option.
        Parameters:
        sides - The indices for the given polygon
